job_title: Mental Health Technician in Manchester, NH
pros: Great team structure, great support by upper management.
cons: Short staffed as every unit within a hospital.

pros: Coworkers were amazing for the most part.
cons: Not enough nurses just like most places.

pros: Amazing experience. A full range of using your nursing skills.
cons: If you work night shift in the ER- you will most likely experience lateral violence if you are a female.

pros: Excellent direct nursing managers, and a great team of co-workers.
cons: There was definite confusion with our role in covering routine consults and call duty for the hospital. Hospital admin not sympathetic or understanding of the needs of the clinic or our staff. No raise in 2021, then it was minimal (just over 1%) in 2022, not merit based, while nurses and LNAs had large salary increases.

pros: Great team to work with

pros: Large hospital with great trauma teams.
cons: Vacation days are taken for holidays.

pros: Competitive pay. 403b contibution match. Benefits for working 30+ hrs. Peers are supportive. Great doctors the units I worked.
cons: A lot of Floating to other units, and working short staffed. You get a written warning if you call out 4 times in a 365 day period but also there is a policy stating you can’t work if you have had diarrhea, vomiting, or fever in last 24 hrs. … so don’t get sick…. Working every other weekend and 2 of every 3 holidays (but that’s probably most hospitals). HR not flexible.

review_title: Good place to work, benefits aren't great

Good working environment
Management is nice
cons: Benefits are not great. Need more PTO.

pros: Gain experience, Make a couple friends
cons: Everything. Management is ruled by favoritism.. not skills, experience or education. Pay is low with laughable yearly “raises”. Patient to staff ratios are non existent. LNAs do 99.9 percent of all patient care yet get treated like garbage.

review_title: Very great team members to work with!
job_title: Patient Service Representative in Manchester, NH

cons: The down fall is trying to learn Epic. The past couple of weeks I have learned more from my coworkers than training. Other than that I have nothing else bad to say about the position I’m in.

review_title: I would never leave this position, i feel great here

review_title: Great People, Mediocre Leadership, Poor Human Resources
pros: People are hard working, patients are great.
cons: They will try to underpay, pressure you to practice poor work-life balance, HR actively dislikes working with employees.

pros: Caring employers. Plenty of support from coworkers
cons: The pay is not great.

pros: Teamwork, opportunities for growth we good within the company
cons: Compensation and short staffed consistently

pros: Great staff. Loved my office.
cons: Hard to be down sized after 32 years due to Covid

pros: Flexibility, good support, great residence program
cons: Does pay as much as other hospitals

pros: Good hospital, cafeteria is great
cons: Low wages, staff can be cliquey

pros: I worked for the Elliot for nearly 13 years. The people I worked with on a day to day basis were some of the best people I've ever worked with and became friends with a few of them. I also enjoyed the patients that I worked with as a patient services registrar.
cons: Sometimes ideas or suggestions were not always welcome. A few ideas I did have got used. However some ideas as to how to improve the structure of how to make things more efficient often fell on deaf ears, as management stuck to how they wanted things done and problems remained.

review_title: Management demanding with bad choices that you are expected to follow
pros: Pay scale above rest in area.   State of the art emr that change continuously to meet needs of all.  Coworkers are why I stayed so long.  One of better food service cafes in a hospital that I have experienced    Parking can be very difficult first thing in the morning
cons: Forced to do work that don't always feel is compliant.   Managers flex their elbows and may not necessary be correct.  They have lots of power because no upper management.  Some treat employees poorly

pros: Great sense of community. The Elliot feels like a town within the city. Many long term employees. Patients are loyal,but the challenges are growing as the community changes. Good leadership direction now with some bad apples cut from the tree. A few more need to be pruned, but the management team is moving in the right direction. Good energy and spirit in the organization. I only left because my family moved.
cons: The main hospital needs a face lift. There are a few directors retired in place (RIP) as we say.

pros: In general, staff is very pleasant
cons: Management needs a serious overhaul.  HR is certainly not looking out for employees.  I think the institution is financially in distress.  They've eliminated or reduced most benefits to the point where they are no longer competitive, eliminated positions, reduced salary increased,...and seem to be seriously cash-strapped.  Many departments suffer from a lack of capital improvements.  Old equipment/technology is everywhere.  They haven't kept up...at the main hospital at least, but one would never guess that based on the propaganda they send out.

pros: Elliot Hospitals is located in a wonderful state!  The hospital has a very good cafeteria and parking issues seem to have been alleviated.
cons: Very average employer with benefits that annually deteriorate.  Unless you are fortunate enough to be in high-demand, your compensation will stagnate.  Management does not seem very concerned about employees in general.

pros: Great job opportunities. Regular classes to keep up with credits needed. Great staff. Free gym membership and discounts at rivers edge pharmacy.  Discount on meals
cons: Slow raises.  Only 2% after a year.  Get written up if out sick more than a few times a year.   Flu shot a must to work here

review_title: Excellent place to work. Great co workers and supervisors.
pros: Supervisors and co workers were great. Pay wasn't bad for the type of work you do. Lots of benefits and discounts.
cons: Not really anything negative to say. Maybe working one weekend a month just because its not as busy in my department and the day drags.

review_title: Great place to work, don't get lost in the system.
pros: Lots of perks, as an employee you can get discounts at retailers in the community, you can also buy what ever the Elliot buys, such as diapers and medical supplies even food that that the kitchen purchases.
cons: The medical benefits could be better. Your part of such a large system sometimes your just a number instead if an employee.

pros: Excellent consultant physicians.  Culture is positive and employee driven.  Leadership is for the most part ethical and hard working.  Good recruiting at all staff levels.
cons: Schedule is chaotic at times.  Promotions can be difficult for mid level staff and nurses with quality work history.  Training through human resources is generally top notch with very few exceptions.

pros: The people who work at there are great. The clinical people are all top notch. They have nice facilities and it is a safe place to work.
cons: The officers and upper level management are out of touch. They spend all their time in meetings and working with each other.

review_title: Low pay and lack of respect
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Manchester, NH
pros: Discounts in the community, and employee store.
cons: Not enough staff, low pay, lack of parking, and lack of respect towards employees. Being mandated to work days that you said you can’t work when asked.

pros: Co-workers are supportive of each other, work well as a team and willing to share knowledge. Food in cafeteria is good and priced well.
cons: Upper Management has experienced nearly a 100% turnover. No support or communication from the top down at all. Benefits are the poorest I have seen, you have to see an Elliot doctor or you pay even more out of pocket. Work life balance is non-existent.

pros: It's an ok place for your first job, but most people use it as a stepping stone. They have a great EMR.
cons: Pay is on the low side and health insurance isn't that great.

pros: The nice patients, and some coworkers that want to do a good job and treat others well.
cons: Pay, benefits, culture, safety, employee retention, constant revolving door

pros: The boss of the department, Lisa Demos, was great and the workers were fun to work with. Very respectful environment. The patients were friendly
cons: Some days were a bit light and it was hard to keep focus

pros: Great people and a great environment
cons: No room for advancement, raises were not efficient to meet cost of living increases
